alert.note: Alert for Adair; Casey; Russell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 6:32PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Russell, southeastern Casey and east central Adair Counties through 700 PM EDT/600 PM CDT/... At 632 PM EDT/532 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Liberty to 7 miles northeast of Columbia. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Russell, southeastern Casey and east central Adair Counties, including the following locations... Mintonville, Lawhorn Hill, Windsor, Teddy, Webbs Cross Roads, Sano, Gilpin, Cantown, Decatur and Evans Ford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
